title: Does articoolo.com generate good articles for SEO? - Quora

response.answer_text: Articoolo creates content utilizing a similar turning technique. What it has included is a summarizing layer above it. May not be smart thought to get articles from them, considering Google may refresh its calculation whenever to recognize reworded content and punish you for copy content. I have given it a shot of personal responsibility however when I checked sentences in Google, I have discovered that they are taken from different articles so it certainly doesn't create novel substance.

I believe Matt Cutts has moved on, but I might be mistaken, he talks about grammar, synonyms, antonym changes and he didn’t seem very concerned. I think 2017 is going to mark huge changes with SEO, because it may be easy to cut and paste text, now wait until search engines transcribe voices. %85 of the traffic is predicted to be video…
Simply, no. I have tried it out of self interest but when I checked sentences in Google, I have found that they are taken from other articles so it definitely does not produce unique content.

I never tried Articoolo's, but I have a suggestion for you to write the article yourself. Because you know what you exactly want on your website, and how the traffic is generated with the blog. So write content according to yourself.
